sometimes people take you for a ride and

intend something bad but fake good
intentions you hoodwink someone the word
hoodwink basically means to deceive or
to cheat someone it means you actually
make someone believe something that is
not true you do that by tricking or
misleading them into doing wrong things
hoodwinking is a sly act as you actually
deceive someone a person who hood winks
is called a hood Winker for example a
mechanic tricks you into buying a
second-hand car stating that the engine
is good but after buying it you actually
spend a lot of money on its repairs and
eventually you realize that you were
deceived it means you were hoodwinked by
your mechanic into buying the car the
word hoodwink is a verb as it shows the
action of cheating or tricking someone
into something and the word hoodwinked
is the past and past participle forms of
the verb okay now that you know what
hoodwink means let's take a look at some
example sentences to see how you can use
it in your daily conversation
example one the attractive display of
shoes and bags at the discounted store
aimed at hoodwinking ladies by selling

hood winks the audience by performing
with his superficial magical powers
example 3 richard hoodwinked his
